image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

title.children: Favouritism, fear and double standards: SA Parliament's culture under fire

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt sitting in a wheelchair on a ramp at the back of a vehicle next to a man in a checked shirt

props.synopsis: When there are so few taxis in your regional city that you can actually use, it can be detrimental to your independence when it no longer shows up.

title.children: City's only wheelchair taxi missing in action leaving customers in limbo

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player poses for the cameras with his premiership medal, kneeling next to his wife and son.

props.synopsis: Adelaide could not satisfy Brisbane in the AFL trade negotiations for Callum Ah Chee, but finally land the target through the pre-season draft.

title.children: Crows land flag star Ah Chee as players earn AFL lifelines

image.altText: thne sun setting over Mooloolaba i n queensland

props.synopsis: Three major weather events are unfolding across Australia this weekend, with the assortment of intense weather set to impact several capitals.

title.children: Sydney among capital cities to be impacted by intense weather conditions

image.altText: A ute under a plastic tarp on the back of a tow truck.

props.synopsis: A ute captured on CCTV outside a workshop where an Adelaide father-of-two's body was later found has now been located, police say, with a lead detective describing the development as a "significant breakthrough" in the investigation into the alleged murder.

title.children: Murder investigation 'breakthrough' as police find ute captured on CCTV

image.altText: A woman in a blue suit sits on a walker at a garden courtyard

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman says her elective surgery has been cancelled four times in the past few months as SA Health data shows nearly 25,000 people are waiting for elective surgeries across the state's public hospitals.

title.children: Health network boss apologises to Adelaide woman for spine surgery delays

image.altText: An extreme close-up of a parasite.

props.synopsis: The deadly bee parasite has been detected in South Australia again — this time in the state's south-east.

title.children: Varroa mite found at second site in South Australia

image.altText: A silver knife attached to a grey spikey chain

props.synopsis: A man has been reported after police allegedly saw him "wearing a knife blade affixed to a chain around his neck" at a suburban Adelaide shopping centre.

title.children: 'A little bit of a weird one': Man reported for knife necklace at shopping centre

image.altText: person holding a dead baby dolphin

props.synopsis: Adelaide's stormwater network has been discharging high loads of sediment into the Gulf of St Vincent for decades, killing off seagrasses that are a key defence against blooms of the kind wreaking havoc in South Australia.

title.children: Is Adelaide's stormwater contributing to the algal bloom crisis?

image.altText: A man stares sombrely at the camera while reaching for his firefighting uniform.

props.synopsis: Country Fire Service volunteer Shaun Arnold says verbal abuse from the public is causing some volunteers to quit, a reality he does not want this fire danger season.

title.children: Country firies receiving 'a lot of abuse' from motorists plead for respect

image.altText: A man without a shirt wearing a blue hat poses for a photo by a lake with kids.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

title.children: Olympic gold medalist swaps coast for the outback on mental health tour

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: South Australia police say several searches have been carried out on multiple premises in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands, including the administration offices in Umuwa.

title.children: Anti-corruption police raid APY Lands administration office

image.altText: Jasmine smiles while wearing a red jacket and black wide-brimmed hat with a cream underside

props.synopsis: A mother standing trial for the alleged criminal neglect and manslaughter of her daughter made the girl hit herself, locked her in an alarmed room and cut off most of her hair, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

title.children: Court hears from child who witnessed alleged abuse in manslaughter neglect case

image.altText: Prawns

props.synopsis: As consumers it's almost impossible to tell if a label on food is genuine. A small team of scientists are taking on this big problem.

title.children: Inside the $50 billion food fraud industry

image.altText: A worker carries a solar panel sheet on his head

props.synopsis: Unshackled from legacy fossil fuel interests, the world’s clean energy future is being forged in the bustling cities of the global south.

title.children: Accessible, cheap clean energy could spark a new world order

image.altText: Sussan Ley sits in Question Time.

props.synopsis: Labor is trying to keep a low profile while the opposition fends off One Nation and Sussan Ley fights for her job.

title.children: Labor keeps a low profile while the opposition fends off One Nation

image.altText: Two small babies, joined at the abdomen, lying on little hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A team of specialised doctors from Sydney has flown to Papua New Guinea to determine whether a rare set of conjoined twins can be surgically separated.

title.children: Pilot flew ‘one body, two souls’ in extraordinary medical airlift

props.synopsis: Australia and the European Union “edging closer” to a free trade deal and a luxury car tax is potentially on the table as a bargaining chip.

title.children: European cars could become cheaper in EU trade deal

image.altText: Five different packets of sliced ham and roast beef arranged together on a white background

props.synopsis: Multiple deli meat products sold in two Australian states have been recalled over fears of possible listeria contamination.

title.children: Recall notice issued for deli meats over listeria contamination risk

image.altText: Cameron Green is struck in the head by a delivery in first Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: Australia is refusing to rule out a second-day comeback in the first men's Ashes Test, despite England decimating the host's batting line-up in Perth.

title.children: Aussies remind England 'there's a long time left' in first Ashes Test

image.altText: Minjee Lee holds a golf ball with her right hand as she smiles at the Tour Championship.

props.synopsis: Jeeno Thitikul is setting the pace at the $17 million Tour Championship in Florida, but Australia's three-time major winner Minjee Lee is in the mix.

title.children: Three-time major winner Lee stays in contention at Tour Championship

image.altText: CGI characters Woody, a cowboy doll, and Buzz Lightyear, an astronaut action figure, smile on a bed.

props.synopsis: Toy Story made history as the world's first computer-animated feature film. As it celebrates 30 years, we look back on the cinematic hit that sparked a technological revolution.

title.children: As Toy Story turns 30, we look back on the film that changed animation

image.altText: Question mark and quotation marks hanging from strings

props.synopsis: This week we have some choice words from Dave Grohl, a blob in the sky, a "wee dancer" and an unsuspecting bandicoot.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: Nirvana's set list, a visitor from space, smashed avo and some unsuspecting prey

image.altText: A smiling young Noongar woman lies on her back in green grass, arms crossed above her head and wearing floral print navy dress.

props.synopsis: Connecting language and country with culture and community, Bumpy's beautiful debut album is closing the gap through music.

title.children: Meet Bumpy, the artist behind one of the year's most beautiful albums

image.altText: A man with a beard with his hands out leaning on a bar counter

props.synopsis: Once a one-off occurrence, publicans are now reporting "multiple per week" fake IDs.

title.children: 'Banned until after 19': Pubs and clubs take new stance against fake IDs

image.altText: Parma wallabies eating food on the grass.

props.synopsis: The parma wallaby was thought to be extinct until Peter Pigott followed up on a rumour that a 19th century governor took a bunch of the mammals to New Zealand proved to be true.

title.children: Man's half-century bid to save rare 'snack size' island wallabies

image.altText: A look down a street with houses and trees on both sides, with a industrial plant in the distance.

props.synopsis: The West Australian government is hailing its buyback scheme for houses coated in dust in Port Hedland as a success. But with more than 100 homes still not sold back, some residents are not making plans to leave.

title.children: Dust buyback scheme in mining town set to close as some residents refuse to leave

image.altText: Hundreds of teenagers in a marquee dancing with disco lights and a DJ at a podium.

props.synopsis: Health authorities warn WA school leavers to be aware of an increase in sexually transmitted infections as they embark on end-of-school celebrations.

title.children: Sexual health warning for school leavers as celebrations begin

image.altText: A gun placed on a blue blanket

props.synopsis: Police were called to a home in Bossley Park on Friday morning after reports of a public place shooting.

title.children: 16yo one of two charged after shots fired at Sydney home

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: Two buyer's advocates voice concerns about the Victorian government's proposal to stamp out underquoting at auctions.

title.children: Unexpected criticism for Victoria's reserve price real estate law

image.altText: Composite image of three people killed at Wieambilla in 2022

props.synopsis: The families of constables Matthew Arnold and Rachel McCrow, who died along with neighbour Alan Dare in the deadly 2022 ambush, had hoped for more.

title.children: Families of murdered officers 'disappointed' by Wieambilla inquest findings

image.altText: A four-lane highway under blue sky

props.synopsis: Two people are dead after separate road accidents in regional NSW

title.children: Driver dies after four-wheel-drive hit by runaway trailer

image.altText: The Indian HAL Tejas during a demonstration moments before crashing

props.synopsis: The Indian HAL Tejas, a combat aircraft used in the Indian Air Force, appeared to lose control and dive directly toward the ground just prior to crashing inside the grounds of the airfield.

title.children: Pilot killed in Indian fighter jet crash during demo flight at Dubai Air Show

image.altText: Liverpool plays Manchester City in Premier League

props.synopsis: Premier League clubs agree to the establishment of spending caps in England's top flight, beginning in the 2026/27 campaign.

title.children: English Premier League to introduce spending cap next season

image.altText: 2025-11-17T125307Z_741427822_RC2CYHAFXUU6_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-FRANCE-MACRON

props.synopsis: In a sombre address to Ukraine's citizens, the president vowed he would not betray Ukrainian interests in the US-led peace process.

title.children: Ukraine faces 'difficult choice' of losing dignity or US backing, says Zelenskyy
